page.title: 08The Miners Strike: Dalkeith
page.content:
This is an account based on reports in the local newspaper, "The Advertiser". Many miners stay in Dalkeith and work in the mining industry in nearby Bilston Glen and Monktonhall pits.
The strike began in March 1984 and local miners organised a rally in Dalkeith. In June half the Dalkeith strike committee were arrested during a meeting. Picket line violence escalated at Bilston Glen and complaints were made by 33 miners who were detained for 18 hours in police cells in Dalkeith. In August Arthur Scargill, President of the NUM addressed a rally of 5,000 people in Dalkeith. By march 1985 when the strike ended 1,244 miners had drifted back to Bilston Glen but only 632 had resumed at Monktonhall.
